Public Class WebHeaderCollection Inherits NameValueCollection Implements ISerializable
type WebHeaderCollection = class inherit NameValueCollection interface ISerializable

Docs.summary: Contains protocol headers associated with a request or response.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection> class is generally accessed through <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.Headers%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.Net.WebResponse.Headers%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>. Some common headers are considered restricted and are either exposed directly by the API (such as `Content-Type`) or protected by the system and cannot be changed.
The restricted headers are:
- Accept
- Connection
- Content-Length
- Content-Type
- Date
- Expect
- Host
- If-Modified-Since
- Range
- Referer
- Transfer-Encoding
- User-Agent
- Proxy-Connection

MemberSignature.Value: public void Add (string header);
.method public hidebysig instance void Add(string header) cil managed
Public Sub Add (header As String)
public: void Add(System::String ^ header);
override this.Add : string -> unit

Docs.param: The header to add, with the name and value separated by a colon.
Docs.summary: Inserts the specified header into the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `header` parameter must be specified in the format "name:value". If the specified header does not exist in the collection, a new header is added to the collection.
If the header specified in `header` is already present in the collection, the value part of the `header` is concatenated with the existing value.
## Examples The following example adds a name/value pair to a <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection> using the <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.Add%2A> Method.
[!code-cpp[WebHeaderCollection_Add#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_Add/CPP/webheadercollection_add.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebHeaderCollection_Add#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_Add/CS/webheadercollection_add.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebHeaderCollection_Add#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_Add/VB/webheadercollection_add.vb#1)]

If the specified header is already present, `value` is added to the comma-separated list of values associated with the header.

Docs.summary: Inserts a header with the specified name and value into the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the header specified in `name` does not exist, the <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.Add%2A> method inserts a new header into the list of header name/value pairs.
If the header specified in `name` is already present, `value` is added to the existing comma-separated list of values associated with `name`.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool IsRestricted (string headerName);
.method public static hidebysig bool IsRestricted(string headerName) cil managed
Public Shared Function IsRestricted (headerName As String) As Boolean
public: static bool IsRestricted(System::String ^ headerName);
static member IsRestricted : string -> bool

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The header to test.
Docs.summary: Tests whether the specified HTTP header can be set for the request.
Docs.returns: if the header is restricted; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.IsRestricted%2A> method returns `true` to indicate that a header is restricted and must be set using properties instead of directly or is set by the system. The restricted headers are:
- Accept
- Connection
- Content-Length
- Content-Type
- Date
- Expect
- Host
- If-Modified-Since
- Range
- Referer
- Transfer-Encoding
- User-Agent
- Proxy-Connection
## Examples The following example checks the <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.IsRestricted%2A> property to see if any headers are prohibited from being set.
[!code-cpp[WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted/CPP/webheadercollection_isrestricted.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted/CS/webheadercollection_isrestricted.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted/VB/webheadercollection_isrestricted.vb#1)]

contains invalid characters.

Does the Framework test the response or the request?
Docs.summary: Tests whether the specified HTTP header can be set for the request or the response.
Docs.returns: if the header is restricted; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.IsRestricted%2A> method returns `true` to indicate that a request or response header is restricted and must be set using properties instead of directly or is set by the system. The restricted headers are:
- Accept
- Connection
- Content-Length
- Content-Type
- Date
- Expect
- Host
- If-Modified-Since
- Range
- Referer
- Transfer-Encoding
- User-Agent
- Proxy-Connection
## Examples The following example checks the <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.IsRestricted%2A> property to see if any request headers are prohibited from being set.
[!code-cpp[WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted/CPP/webheadercollection_isrestricted.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted/CS/webheadercollection_isrestricted.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_IsRestricted/VB/webheadercollection_isrestricted.vb#1)]

## Remarks If the header specified in the header does not exist, the <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.Set%2A> method inserts a new header into the list of header name/value pairs.
If the header specified in `header` is already present, `value` replaces the existing value.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.Set%2A> method to set the value of an existing header.
[!code-cpp[WebHeaderCollection_Set#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_Set/CPP/webheadercollection_set.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[WebHeaderCollection_Set#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_Set/CS/webheadercollection_set.cs#1)] [!code-vb[WebHeaderCollection_Set#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/WebHeaderCollection_Set/VB/webheadercollection_set.vb#1)]
